ExampleDefinition.Description:
Demonstrates how to create a Radar Chart. A radar chart is a graphical method of displaying multivariate data in the form of a two-dimensional chart of three or more quantitative variables represented on axes starting from the same point. The relative position and angle of the axes is typically uninformative. This is a circular chart type consisting of sectors which are proportional to the quantity it represents.
[i][b]Tips![/i][/b] [i]You can change the style of every category.[/i]
[i]Every series can be configurable. You can change fill brush, stroke color, opacity...[/i]
[i]Hole in center can be changed in real time.[/i]
[i]Radar rotation can be changed in real time too.[/i]
